            for (int j = i; j > lo; --j) {
                if (a[j] < a[j - 1]) {
                    exch(a[j], a[j - 1]);
                } else {
                    break;

    template<typename T>
    void shell_sort(std::vector<T>& a, int lo, int hi) {
        int N = hi - lo + 1;

        // decide decrease sequence
        int h = 1;
        while (h < N / 3) {
            h = 3 * h + 1;
        }

        while (h >= 1) {
            // h-sort the array
            for (int i = h + lo; i <= hi; ++i) {
                for (int j = i; j >= h + lo && a[j] < a[j - h]; j -= h) {
                    exch(a[j], a[j - h]);
                }
            }
            h = h / 3;
        }
    }
```

        void sink(int k) {
            // make sure k is not the bottom level
            while (2 * k <= N_) {
                // j is the left children
                int j = 2 * k;
                if (j < N_ && pq_[j] < pq_[j + 1]) {
                    // now, j is the bigger children
                    j++;
                }

                if (pq_[k] > pq_[j]) {
                    break;
                }

                // if parent node is smaller than the bigger children, exchange
                exch(pq_[k], pq_[j]);

                // sink down a level
                k = j;
            }

        }
```

  template<typename T>
    void sink(std::vector<T>& a, int k, int N) {
        // NOTE: the value of node k is a[k - 1]

        // make sure k is not the bottom level
        while (2 * k < N) {
            // j is the left children
            int j = 2 * k;
            if (j < N && a[j - 1] < a[j]) {
                // now, j is the bigger children
                j++;
            }

            if (a[k - 1] > a[j - 1]) {
                break;
            }

            // if parent node is smaller than the bigger children, exchange
            exch(a[k - 1], a[j - 1]);

            // sink down a level
            k = j;
        }
    }
    // Heap construction
    for (int k = N / 2; k >= 1; --k) {
        // loop for every non leaf node
        sink(pq, k, N);
    }

    template<typename T>
    void heap_sort(std::vector<T>& pq) {
        int N = pq.size();

        // Heap construction
        for (int k = N / 2; k >= 1; --k) {
            // loop for every non leaf node
            sink(pq, k, N);
        }

        // Sort down
        while(N > 1) {
            exch(pq[0], pq[N - 1]);
            sink(pq, 1, --N);
        }
    }
```

```c++
    // merge tow subarray
    template<typename T>
    void merge(std::vector<T>& a, std::vector<T>& aux, int lo, int mid, int hi) {
        for (int i = lo; i <= hi; ++i) {
            aux[i] = a[i];
        }

        int m = lo;
        int n = mid + 1;
        for (int i = lo; i <= hi; ++i) {
            if (m > mid) {
                a[i] = aux[n++];
            } else if (n > hi) {
                a[i] = aux[m++];
            } else if (aux[n] < aux[m]) {
                a[i] = aux[n++];
            } else {
                a[i] = aux[m++];
            }
        }
    }

    // resuive sort
    const int CUTOFF = 7;
    template<typename T>
    void merge_sort(std::vector<T>& a, std::vector<T>& aux, int lo, int hi) {
        if (hi <= lo) {
            return;
        }

        // use insertion sort for small subarrays
        if (hi <= lo + CUTOFF - 1) {
            insertion_sort(a, lo, hi);
            return;
        }

        int mid = lo + (hi - lo) / 2;
        merge_sort(a, aux, lo, mid);
        merge_sort(a, aux, mid + 1, hi);

        // do not merge if already sorted
        if (a[mid] < a[mid + 1]) {
            return;
        }

        merge(a, aux, lo, mid, hi);
    }
```

    template<typename T>
    void bottom_up_merge_sort(std::vector<T>& a, std::vector<T>& aux, int lo, int hi) {
        int N = hi - lo + 1;
        for (int sz = 1; sz < N; sz += sz) {
            for (int k = lo; k < lo + N - sz; k += (sz + sz)) {
                merge(a, aux, k, k + sz - 1, std::min(k + sz + sz - 1, N - 1));
            }
        }
    }

```c++
    template<typename T>
    int partition(std::vector<T>& a, int lo, int hi) {
        int i = lo;
        int j = hi + 1;

        while(true) {
            // process i pointer
            // find item on left to swap
            while(a[++i] < a[lo]) {
                if (i == hi) {
                    break;
                }
            }

            // process j pointer
            // find item on right to swap
            while(a[--j] > a[lo]) {
                if (j == lo) {
                    break;
                }
            }

            // find if pointers cross
            if (i >= j) {
                break;
            }

            // swap
            exch(a[i], a[j]);
        }

        // swap with partition item
        exch(a[lo], a[j]);

        // return index of item now known to be in place
        return j;
    }


    template<typename T>
    void quick_sort_sub(std::vector<T>& a, int lo, int hi) {
        if (hi <= lo + CUTOFF) {
            // improvement 1:  use insertion fort for small subarray
            insertion_sort(a, lo, hi);
            return;
        }

        // improvement 2: estimate partition item with median of three samples
        int m = median_of_three(a, lo, lo + (hi - lo)/ 2, hi);
        exch(a[lo], a[m]);

        int j = partition(a, lo, hi);
        quick_sort_sub(a, lo, j - 1);
        quick_sort_sub(a, j + 1, hi);
    }

    template<typename T>
    void quick_sort(std::vector<T>& a) {
        // shuffle is needed for performance guarantee
        shuffle(a);

        quick_sort_sub<T>(a, 0, static_cast<int>(a.size()) - 1);
    }
```

```c++
    // * Let v be partitioning item a[lo].
    // * Scan i from left to right.
    //  - (a[i] < v): exchange a[lt] with a[i]; increment both lt and i
    //  - (a[i] > v): exchange a[gt] with a[i]; decrement gt;
    //  - (a[i] == v): increment i
    template<typename T>
    void quick_sort_3way_sub(std::vector<T>& a, int lo, int hi) {
        if (hi <= lo + CUTOFF) {
            // improvement 1:  use insertion fort for small subarray
            insertion_sort(a, lo, hi);
            return;
        }

        int lt = lo;
        int i = lo;
        int gt = hi;

        // improvement 2: estimate partition item with median of three samples
        int m = median_of_three(a, lo, lo + (hi - lo)/ 2, hi);
        exch(a[lo], a[m]);

        // partition item
        T v = a[lo];

        while(i <= gt) {
            if (a[i] < v) {
                exch(a[lt++], a[i++]);
            } else if (a[i] > v) {
                exch(a[i], a[gt--]);
            } else {
                i++;
            }
        }

        quick_sort_3way_sub(a, lo, lt - 1);
        quick_sort_3way_sub(a, gt + 1, hi);
    }

    template<typename T>
    void quick_sort_3way(std::vector<T>& a) {
        // shuffle is needed for performance guarantee
        shuffle(a);

        quick_sort_3way_sub<T>(a, 0, static_cast<int>(a.size()) - 1);
    }
```

## 

[](http://planet.openstreetmap.org/)[](http://download.geofabrik.de/index.html) osm  pbf  xml pbf 

 sql 

```
createdb osm
psql -d osm -c 'CREATE EXTENSION postgis; CREATE EXTENSION hstore;'
```

 osm  pgAdmin 



```
osm2pgsql -c -d osm --slim -C <75% Mem> --flat-nodes <flat nodes> -U gis -W -H localhost -P 5432 you.osm.pbf
```

*-C*75% Mb30000*--flat-nodes* 20G
8G Macbook Pro 10G

## 

 .bash_profile  windows 

```
export WORKDIR_OSM=$HOME/.osmosis
```



```
mkdir $WORKDIR_OSM
osmosis --read-replication-interval-init workingDirectory=$WORKDIR_OSM
```

 *osmosis* *osmosis*  *configuration.txt*  *download.lock* *download.lock* *configuration.txt* *osmosis*  *configuration.txt*  *baseurl*  *replication/minute/*  *replication/hour/*  *replication/day/*1 *maxInterval=3600* 0

*osmosis*[Peter Krner's website tool](https://osm.mazdermind.de/replicate-sequences/)UTC *state.txt*



```
osmosis -q --rri --bc --simc --bc --write-xml-change "-" | osm2pgsql -s -a -b "73,3,136,54" -U gis -d osm -P 5432 -H localhost -e 15 -o expire.list -
```

 *-b* *expire.list* 15 dirty tile

linux  crontab  OSM 

 *-b*  sql  way  relation

```
DELETE FROM planet_osm_ways AS w WHERE 0 = (SELECT count(1) FROM planet_osm_nodes AS n WHERE n.id = ANY(w.nodes));

DELETE FROM planet_osm_rels AS r WHERE
  0=(SELECT count(1) FROM planet_osm_nodes AS n WHERE n.id = ANY(r.parts))
AND
  0=(SELECT count(1) FROM planet_osm_ways AS w WHERE w.id = ANY(r.parts));
REINDEX TABLE planet_osm_ways;
REINDEX TABLE planet_osm_rels;
VACUUM FULL;
```

##  Lua
* windows
 [LuaDist](http://luadist.org/) 

* linux
```
curl -R -O http://www.lua.org/ftp/lua-5.3.3.tar.gz
tar zxf lua-5.3.3.tar.gz
cd lua-5.3.3
make linux test
```

* mac
```
curl -R -O http://www.lua.org/ftp/lua-5.3.3.tar.gz
tar zxf lua-5.3.3.tar.gz
cd lua-5.3.3
make macosx test
```

 lua test.lua lua test.lua 

 Lua 

## 
* 
```lua
-- 
```

* 
```lua
--[[
    
    
--]]
```

## 
* nil

```lua
t = nil
```

* boolean
```lua
t = false
```

* number
Luadouble
```lua
num = 42
```

* string
```lua
s1 = ''
s2 = ""
s3 = [[ 
        
         ]]
```
## 
* if 
```lua
if num > 40 then
    print('over 40')
elseif s ~= 'abc' then
    io.write('s is not equal to abc')
else
    print('num <= 40 and s == abc')
end
```

* while 
```lua
while num < 50 do
    num = num + 1
end
```

* for 
```lua
for i = 0, 10 do
    print(i)
end

for j = 100, 1, -1 do
    print(j)
end
```

* and or a?b:c
```lua
ans = aBoolValue and 'yes' or 'no'
```

* repeat until 
```lua
repeat
    print(num)
    num = num - 1
until num == 0
```

## (Functions)
```lua
function fib(n)
    if n < 2 then return n end
    return fib(n - 2) + bib(n - 1)
end

--
function adder(x)
    return function(y) return x + y end
end

a1 = adder(9)
a2 = adder(36)
print(a1(16))  --> 25
print(a2(64))  --> 100

-- 
f = function (x) return x * x end
```

## Tables
TablesLuaTablesTable

```lua
-- 
t = {key1 = 'value1', key2 = false}

-- 
print(t.key1)  -- Prints 'value1'.

--nil
u = {['@!#'] = 'qbert', [{}] = 1729, [6.28] = 'tau'}

--
print(u[6.28])  -- prints "tau"

-- int
v = {'value1', 'value2', 1.21, 'gigawatts'}
for i = 1, #v do  -- #v is the size of v for lists.
  print(v[i])  -- Indices start at 1 !! SO CRAZY!
end
```

## Metatables and metamethods
TableMetatable

```lua
f1 = {a = 1, b = 2}  -- Represents the fraction a/b.
f2 = {a = 2, b = 3}

-- This would fail:
-- s = f1 + f2

metafraction = {}
function metafraction.__add(f1, f2)
  local sum = {}
  sum.b = f1.b * f2.b
  sum.a = f1.a * f2.b + f2.a * f1.b
  return sum
end

setmetatable(f1, metafraction)
setmetatable(f2, metafraction)

s = f1 + f2  -- call __add(f1, f2) on f1's metatable
```
metatable
```lua
-- An __index on a metatable overloads dot lookups:
defaultFavs = {animal = 'gru', food = 'donuts'}
myFavs = {food = 'pizza'}
setmetatable(myFavs, {__index = defaultFavs})
eatenBy = myFavs.animal  -- works! thanks, metatable
```

## 
LuaTableMetatable

Dog
```lua
Dog = {}

function Dog:new()
    local newObj = {sound = 'woof'}
    self.__index = self
    return setmetatable(newObj, self)
end

function Dog:makeSound()
    print('I say ' .. self.sound)
end

mrDog = Dog:new()
mrDog:makeSound() -- 'I say woof'
```
Dog:new Dog:makeSoundself


Dog
```lua
LoundDog = Dog:new()
function = LoundDog:makeSound()
    local s = self.sound .. ' '
    print(s .. s .. s)
end

seymour = LoundDog:new()
seymour:makeSound() -- 'woof woof woof'
```
LoudDog  Dog makeSound

## Modules
Modules
ModulesTable

```lua
-- mymod.lua
local M = {}

local function sayMyName()
  print('Hrunkner')
end

function M.sayHello()
  print('Why hello there')
  sayMyName()
end

return M
```

mymod.lua

```lua
local mod = require('mymod')  -- Run the file mod.lua.

-- This works because mod here = M in mod.lua:
mod.sayHello()  -- Says hello to Hrunkner.

-- This is wrong; sayMyName only exists in mod.lua:
mod.sayMyName()  -- error
```

    if n < 2 then return n end
    return fib(n - 2) + bib(n - 1)
